results.title: Treasures of the Trust
results.brief_description: This superb video takes you on a tour of the paintings, antiques, furniture and gardens of some of Britain’s greatest and most famous homes, castles, and ruins…you’ll learn the history of the locations visited and tour the homes and grounds of National Trust sites. Places visited range from the breathtaking monastic remains of the 12th Century Fountains Abbey in Yorkshire, to the dramatic splendour of St. Michael’s Mount in Cornwall, including Tatton Park in Cheshire, Powis in Wales, Corfe Castle in Dorset, Kingston Lacy in Surrey and Chartwell in Kent.

results.title: Treasures of the earth
results.brief_description: Highlights some of the new techniques being used in exploration, transporting and handling of natural resources in order to meet the increasing needs of modern society. Demonstrates new methods employing electronics, computers, lasers, aircraft, heavy machinery, and seismic equipment in locating additional resources on land and beneath the seas. Industrial promotional film for Litton Industries.

results.title: Treasures of the earth
results.brief_description: Illustrates the physical prosesses that produce concentrations of mineral ores beneath the Earth’s crust. Animated demonstrations of fundamental geological principles are shown. Correlated with “Health Elementary Science” by Herman and Nina Schneider.

results.title: Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (MS)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
The program notes to the four-disk DVD set; 150 page book containing the full credits, transcribed commentary, detailed information on each film including preservation and soundtrack notes. Notes on the music by Martin Marks. Further information: www.filmpreservation.org.

results.title: Treasure planet
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Pictures, Roy Conli, John Musker and Ron Clements
results.brief_description: Walt Disney animated feature based on the novel “Treasure Island” by Robert Louis Stevenson. A dazzling mix with the feel of an old costumed pirate drama combined with space travel adventure. A small boy reads an animated adventure book about pirates on a quest for treasure, all set in space. The sea is replaced by space and the bad pirate is a cyborg, but the story of the personal growth of the young male protagonist is timeless.

results.title: Treasure of the Grotoceans
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Gaston Sarault and Co Hoedeman
results.brief_description: Two Grotoceans sent on a special mission find all kinds of surprises awaiting them as they roam the sea in search of treasure. Octopus-like puppets cut out of foam rubber are the central characters in this delightful underwater fantasy with its message about conservation and ecology.
